channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MD
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MD

item.title: Report X-2024030931
item.description:
Report X-2024030931

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-22T18:13:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-15
  • City: BELTSVILLE
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: I found the ripped, torn and wet package in the damage hazmat cage. I repackaged the damage in a salvage drum and filled out the required reports. DescribePack: One of the four bottles in box had a loose cap. About 1 quart of content leaked out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The wet package was placed in a tub and taken to the damage hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2024030632
item.description:
Report X-2024030632

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-20T15:11:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-12
  • City: LAUREL
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PICK OFF NOTICED LEAKING HAZMAT, STOPPED THE PROGRESS OF THE PACKAGE AND LEFT THE AREA TO NOTIFY SUPERVISOR. RESPONDER WAS CALLED AND RESPONDED IN FULL PPE WITH DECISION. FOLLOWING PROPER RESPONSE SHEET RESPONDER CONTAINED AND CLEANED UP SPILL TO BRING BACK TO DMP FOR PROPER DISPOSAL.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: improperly handled. Dropped. Once noticed that contents were leaking, immediately placed into a hazmat waste container and transported o the damage hazmat cage. DescribePack: dropped causing a big crack at the bottom of the drum. contents steadily leaking out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed into salvage drum to contain the spill

item.title: Report X-2024030525
item.description:
Report X-2024030525

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-06
  • City: LAUREL
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER CALLED TO WHITE BELT FOR LEAKING HAZMAT. RESPONDED WITH FULL PPE, DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET. PACKAGE ON FLOOR, LEAKAGE CONFINED TO PACKAGE. PACKAGE HAD A FLAMMABLE LIQUID LABEL, RESPONDER FOLLOWED FLAMMABLE LIQUID RESPONSE SHEET, CONTAINED PACKAGE IN SPILL TUB AND TRANSPORTED TO DMP FOR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2024030518
item.description:
Report X-2024030518

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-19T15:11:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-07
  • City: LANDOVER
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SUPERVISOR WAS NOTIFIED FOR HAZMAT RESPONDER. WITH PPE (BOOTS,APRON,GOGGLE,GLOVES)ON, TOOK SPILL CART WITH SEVERAL BAGS OF ZEP SORBENT. RESPONDER FORMED A BARRIER SURROUND THE SPILL, CLEANED THE SPILL, AND CONTAINERIZED INTO SPILL TRAYS. RESPONDER TRANSPORTED TO DMP AREA, BAGGED PROCESSED IN HAZMAT/DAMAGE INPUT.

Report X-2024030463

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: discovered damaged in unload.package was dropped.upon inspection one bottle had a loose cap leaking out 10 oz of content. DescribePack: failure was due to package being dropped resulting in internal leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: spill was contained inside outer container.package was placed in haz tote and put under ventilation system.

item.title: Report E-2024030254
item.description:
Report E-2024030254

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-19T15:11:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-11
  • City: HAGERSTOWN
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractorâ€™s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted the 150-gallon poly tote and the contractor was unable to determine the volume of material released due to a forklift puncture of one (1) 150-gallon poly tote. Hepaco personnel stated that they believed that some of the released material evaporated. Hepaco personnel transferred the remaining material into a new poly tote and generated one (1) 55-gallon poly drum containing the cut-up poly tote, impacted absorbents and PPE. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.
